article.description:
Colin Wyatt scored 20 points and grabbed 11 rebounds to lead Elon to a 64-58 win over Wofford on Wednesday afternoon in the first round of the Southern Conference
tournament.
article.headline: Elon will face No. 1 seed Davidson
article.story:
CHATTANOOGA, Tenn. (AP) -- Colin Wyatt scored 20 points and
grabbed 11 rebounds to lead Elon to a 64-58 win over Wofford on
Wednesday afternoon in the first round of the Southern Conference
tournament.

	   No. 4 North seed Elon (8-22) will play Davidson, the league's
only team to go unbeaten in the regular season and the No. 1 South
seed, in the second round Thursday.

	   Eric Marshall hit a 3-pointer that pulled No. 5 South seed
Wofford (14-14) within 61-58 with 17 seconds left, but Wyatt hit
three free throws to seal the victory.

	   Scottie Rice scored 11 for Elon before fouling out.

	   Adrien Borders led Wofford with 15 points, and Marshall added
14.

	   Elon took a 35-24 lead when Chris Chalko hit a 3 on its first
possession of the second half, but Rice quickly picked up his third
foul and Wofford quickly narrowed the gap.

	   The Terriers got within 44-43 on an Eric Marshall layup with
11:22 left, and they took a 49-48 lead on a Greg Taylor layup with
7:29 left. Elon clinched the game at the free throw line, going
19-of-23 compared to just 8-of-14 for the Terriers.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
